title: Update App.tsx initial in-memory Valentine content (landing message, video headings, final message)

requirements.text:

Required default values:

- `finalMessage` default: set exactly to the provided multiline text:
  `"Happy Valentine‚Äôs Day, Flora. I‚Äôve been feeling terrible about last night, and I‚Äôm so sorry for how I acted. You deserve to be treated with nothing but love, especially today. I‚Äôm incredibly lucky to have you, and I‚Äôd love to make it up to you and focus on us. I love you\nthis alr?\n"`

quotes: Your task is to modify the code in the App.tsx file by replacing the current implementation with the following code snippet ... (New Code)

acceptanceCriteria: On a fresh load with no remote saveId in the URL and no existing local saved progress, the Landing page text field is pre-filled with "Happy Valentine's Day, Apshara!".

On a fresh load with no remote saveId in the URL and no existing local saved progress, the Videos page shows the three existing remote MP4 videos and their headings are exactly ü§≠, ü§ê, and "Am I in Love with You? Definitely" (in that order).

On a fresh load with no remote saveId in the URL and no existing local saved progress, the Final Message page textarea is pre-filled with the provided final message text including the line breaks at the end.
Existing remote restore (saveId-based), global-latest restore, and local fallback restore behaviors continue to work unchanged (i.e., saved content overrides these defaults when present).

requirements.text: Add brief inline comments in `frontend/src/App.tsx` adjacent to the modified state initializers explaining that these values are the initial defaults used only when no remote/global/local saved state is available, so future refactors do not accidentally treat them as hard-coded overrides.

quotes: The output should be structured as a clear, well-commented code block, ensuring that the changes made are easily understandable. Additionally, include a brief explanation of the modifications and the reasons behind them.

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/App.tsx` contains short, clear comments near `landingMessage`, `videoSlots`, and `finalMessage` initializers indicating they are fallback defaults before restore/hydration.
No new functionality is introduced; comments do not change runtime behavior.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, and anything under `frontend/src/components/ui`.
Keep the existing save/restore, polling, and navigation logic intact; only update initial default state values and add clarifying comments.
nonGoals: Do not redesign UI styling, layout, or navigation behavior.
Do not change backend APIs, Motoko canister logic, or remote save/restore protocol.
Do not modify the three remote MP4 URLs or reintroduce local video upload behavior.
